title: How to create a horror book - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t create a horror book, you write a horror book. The tip to write a successful book in any genre is to avoid using cliches. Vampires, werewolves and the like have been exploited so often that you’d be hard-pressed to come with something innovative. Honestly, the best thing you can do is to read other horror books. Stephen King, for example, tries putting ordinary people in extraordinary circumstances, and that’s one of the reasons he’s famous. I can’t name horror writers off the top of my head, but a bit of googling can always help. Remember, don’t try emulating their style unless for practising. If you’re just starting off as a writer, I’d advise you to consider writing short-stories first. Take part in competitions, too. Finally, with a bit of experience and imagination, you’d be able to start writing your book. Good luck!

Try telling your best friend a scary story. If you can't scare your friend the first time, try again. Write it down or record it. Work from your best effort, but remember to rewrite painstakingly, and embellish it. Then do an expanded outline from there, and write and rewrite the story.
